text:
While deploying my web application using ANT, I had to include the fesi 
javascript interpretor .jar file. I included the jar (got from 
http://www.home.worldcom.ch/jmlugrin/fesi/) in the /lib directory, ran the ant 
build, verified that all files were copied over to the /webapps directory of 
tomcat. After restarting Tomcat, the application I deployed was not registered 
in Tomcat. After removing fesi.jar, the web app was recognized once again.
Steps to reproduce:
1. build a shell web application
2. put fesi.jar in the /lib directory
3. run a ant build to deploy the application to tomcat 4
4. restart tomcat
5. point browser to your web app.
6. observe the 404
creator: matthew@softwarearena.com
craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
Could you please send the contents of the log files that are created
by Tomcat when you execute the steps you have listed?  Without these,
it is almost impossible to diagnose what is going on.

No additional documentation was provided as requested, so closing this bug for 
now.
creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
